example: I want scrambled eggs for breakfast
No way! That can't be true.
This way, follow me!
In March, I'll travel to a town in the countryside.
This city has many beautiful spots to visit.

description: Aquela pessoa estagnada. Entrevada!

example: I work on Mondays as well.
He plans to take over his father's business next year.
description: Assumir o controle

example: I'm so mad right now. | He's mad about sports.
Jack passed away yesterday morning.
I'm afraid I can't help you
He fears losing his job.
If you do it that way, it will be much easier.
description: No final da frase
Mais grave
Mais leve

example: It is annoying.
He pounded on the door until someone answered.
description: No sentido de bater na porta, por exemplo.

example: She let out (deu) a deep sigh when she heard the news.
I didn't realize how late it was.
Can you remind me to call my friend later ?
Her kindness towards strangers is truly inspiring.
description: Algo como alguém que faz algo doce (gentil, bom)

example: he holds an apple. | He is holding an apple.
She dressed quickly in the morning.
description: No sentido de estar com uma roupa. Verbo Dress.

example: It sounds stranger to me.
Over the last week, I've worked a lot.
description: Over the... ao longo ou durante

translation: Notar | Prestar atenção a algo | Perceber | Aviso (substantivo)
example: I didn't notice you were here. | Did you notice the new painting on the wall ? | She received a notice about the meeting.
Make sure the table is even before placing the vase.
he didn't even say goodbye.
The company needs even out its expenses.
She walked towards the door. | His attitude towards me has changed. | The car was heading towards the city.
She is a great singer. Moreover (além disso), she is a talented dancer. | He project is delayed, and moreover, we are facing (enfrentando) budget issues.
I didn't recognize her at first. | Can you recognize this place ? | He recognized the song as soon as (assim que) it started playing.

translation: Esforçar-se | Lutar por algo com dedicação

example: Our goals align with yours

description: Algo que não foi finalizado

example: I was looking forward to this moment. | You were looking forward to meeting you.
description: Look forward

example: She is struggling to finish her homework. | I’ve been struggling with this problem for days.
description: Verbo [struggle] que significa lutar, ter dificuldades ou enfrentar desafios

translation: Luvas sem a parte dos dedos

example: Would you like anything else ? | Is there anything else I can do for you ? | I don’t think there’s anything else to discuss.
description: É comumente usada para perguntar se há mais alguma coisa ou se alguém precisa de algo mais.

example: The park is over there. | You can find the restaurant over there, near the corner. | I saw him over there, talking to someone.
description: É uma expressão que indica um lugar distante de quem está falando, geralmente em uma direção específica.

translation: O que mais... | Mais o que...
example: What else do you need from me ? | What else can we do to help ? | What else happened at the meeting ?
description: É uma expressão usada para perguntar se há mais alguma coisa, ou para pedir informações adicionais sobre algo.

example: This is indeed a great oportunity.
We ran out of milk. | Hurry up (depressa), we're running out of time! | She ran out of gas on the way home. | They ran out of tickets for the concert.
description: Geralmente usada quando algo está prestes a ou já acabou, como recursos, suprimentos ou tempo.

example: The party was over by midnight. | The meeting was over after an hour. | His time in the city was over. | Her vacation was over, so she had to go back to work.
description: Usado para indicar que algo foi concluído ou terminou. Pode ser usada em diversos contextos, como eventos, atividades, sentimentos...

translation: Algo ou alguém estava ausente, fora de um local ou não disponível.
example: I tried to call him, but he was out. | The store was out of the item I wanted. | The power was out for several hours. | She was out of the meeting yesterday.
description: É uma maneira comum de expressar que algo ou alguém não estava presente ou disponível em um momento específico.

example: I will finish this task within an hour. | The package will arrive within three days. | There is a gas station within 5 kilometers. | She acted (agiu) within the law

I was very tired yesterday. Besides that, I had a lot of work to do. | The hotel was too expensive. Besides that, the service was terrible. | I don’t like coffee. Besides that, I prefer tea in the morning.
description: É usado para adicionar mais informações a uma frase.

example: Your behavior hasn't (haven't para plural) been correct. | They had strange behavior. | She has difficult behavior.

translation: Lidar com | Resolver | Entrentar algo ou alguém
example: I have to deal with a lot of emails every day. | She knows how to deal with difficult people. | How do you deal with stress ?
I regret my decision. | She regrets not studying harder. | His biggest regret is not traveling more.
description: Como substantivo pode ser [arrependimento]
O uso de [does] antes do verbo [sound] serve para dar ênfase.

translation: Levantar | Erguer | Aumentar | Criar | Educar | Aumento (substântivo)
example: Please raise your hand if you have a question. | They decided to raise the prices of their products. | She raised three children herself. | He got a raise at work.
pronunciation: Pode ser um verbo ou substantivo, dependendo do contexto. | Alguém faz algo subir.

example: They had an endless supply of food at the party. | Their resources are endless.
description: Geralmente é usada para descrever algo que parece não ter fim ou que é interminável.

translation: Mais | Além disso | Além do mais
example: I have a meeting at 3 PM, plus (além disso) I need to finish my report. | Five plus (mais) three equals eight. | This hotel offers a gym and a pool, which is a big plus (vantagem).
description: Pode ser usado como conjunção, preposição, adjetivo ou substantivo.

example: Technology is constantly evolving. | Her ideas are still evolving. | The company is evolving to meet customer needs.
description: Verbo evolve [evoluir]

translation: Subir | Crescer | Aumentar | Levantar-se | Nascer (Determinados Contextos)
example: The sun rises in the east. | Prices rose last year. | He has risen (se superou) to the challenge
description: Rise, Rose, Risen | Algo sobe por conta própria
Pode ser substântivo ou verbo

translation: Através de... | De um lado para o outro... | Do outro lado...
example: She walked across the street. | They swam across the river. | There's a supermarket across the road. | My best friend lives across the street.
description: Por ser usado como preposição ou advérbio

example: Based on a true story. | Based on true events. | The company is based in New York.
description: Com base ou baseado em algum lugar.

term: I have been with them for about five years now
translation: Eu estive com eles há 5 anos.

example: My Pleasure (Muito pazer)

description: Usamos esse termo quando alguém espirra. Em português geralmente usamos [saúde]

translation: Conversando de maneira informal ou descontraída
example: We were chatting about our plans for the weekend. | I had a nice chat with my friend yesterday.
description: Verbo chat

example: Something unexpected may arise during the meeting. | He arose early to catch the first train. | Problems arise when people don't communicate well. | Problems arise when people don't expect.
description: Algo que começa a acontecer geralmente de maneira inesperada.

example: Her insightful analysis helped us understand the situation better. | He has an insightful look at marketing.
description: Significa algo que demonstra uma compreensão profunda e clara sobre algo, ou que oferece uma perspectiva perspicaz.

translation: Obrigado por me receber | Obrigado por me convidar

term: I have a background in sales and marketing
translation: Eu tenho experiência com vendas e marketing.

example: The company is leveraging (aproveitando ao máximo) its (sua) technology to improve customer service. | She is leveraging her network to find new business opportunities. | They plan to leverage their expertise in marketing to expand their business. | The company plans to leverage its new technology to expand its market share.
description: Usar algo (como recursos, habilidades ou influências) de forma eficaz para alcançar um objetivo, muitas vezes com o intuito de maximizar resultados.

example: There are various options available for the project.

term: I'm a firm believer in continuous learning
translation: Sou um firme defensor do aprendizado continuo.

example: Her efforts to help the community are truly commendable. | he team's performance in the tournament was commendable. | They are commendable for what they made.

translation: Algo que acontece de forma inesperada ou repentina
example: The sudden change in weather surprised everyone. | There was a sudden loud noise outside the window.

translation: É usado para indicar que algo aconteceu de forma rápida e inesperada
example: Suddenly, the lights went out. | Suddenly, she realized she had forgotten her keys. | The weather turned suddenly, and it started to rain.

translation: Se aproximar de algo ou alguém | Abordar
example: She decided to approach the situation with a calm mindset. | We should approach this project with a more organized strategy. | We need to approach this problem carefully. | His approach to teaching is very effective.

translation: Adequação de uma pessoa a uma função

example: You can go to the party, as long as you finish your homework first. | I will help you, provided that you ask politely (educadamente). | You can join the team, as long as you are committed to the project. | He will attend the meeting, provided that he finishes his report on time.
pronunciation: Podemos usar [as long as] ou [provided that]

example: He worked hard to attain success in his career. | She attained the highest score in the class. | The company aims to attain a 10% growth in sales this year.
I fall when I run too fast. | He fell down the stairs. | Every autumn, the leaves fall from the trees. | She fell off the bike when she tried to jump the ramp.
She engages with her audience by asking questions. | The students engaged in a deep discussion about climate change.
This new software enhances productivity in the workplace. | Good lighting enhances the beauty of a room. | Regular practice enhances your chances of success.

Innovative strategies help drive growth in the technology sector. | nvesting in digital marketing can drive growth for small businesses. | New technologies drive growth by increasing efficiency and reducing costs.
She enjoys working in a fast-paced (dinâmico) environment. | The movie had a fast-paced (acelerado) plot that kept the audience engaged.
A rainbow appeared after the rain.
The magician made the rabbit disappear.
I have finished my homework, but everything else can wait. | She bought the dress, but everything else was too expensive.
She is a kind person who always helps others. | It was very kind (gentil) of you to help me with the project.
She gave me a warm hug when I arrived.| I need to warm up my coffee, it's getting cold. | The fireplace will warm the entire room.
The bright light hurt my eyes. | She has a bright future ahead of her. | The room is bright and welcoming.
She always has a cheerful attitude. | The cheerful music made everyone smile.
I ate the whole cake by myself. | She spent the whole day reading. | The whole team was excited about the victory.
Each student must submit (entregar) their assignment (tarefa) by Friday. | I gave each of my friends a gift for their birthday.
I decorated my bathroom yesterday.
The pillow (travesseiro) is very soft, so I sleep well. | She has a soft voice that calms everyone around her. |
I love to hug my friends when I see them. | She gave me a warm hug after the long journey. | He needs a big hug to feel better.
He gave me a tight hug before leaving. | Make sure (certifique-se) the screws (parafusos) are tight so the shelf doesn’t fall.
She wore a beautiful necklace for the party. | I bought a gold necklace for my mother's birthday.
We decided to put off the meeting until next week. | The rain put off our plans for a picnic. | She was put off by his rude behavior.
I fell in love with her the moment I met her. | He fell in love with the city during his vacation. | She fell in love with the idea of traveling the world.

translation: Descreve a ação de fazer algo de maneira alta ou ruidosa, com um volume elevado.
example: She sang loudly during the concert. | He laughed loudly when he heard the funny story.
Don’t shout at people for no reason! | She shouted for help when she saw the fire.

translation: Andar ou viajar em algo, geralmente um veículo ou animal
example: She loves to ride her bike in the park. | We will ride horses through the mountains. | He was riding his motorcycle when it started to rain.
Although it was raining, we went for a walk. | She is very talented, although she is still learning. | Although he was tired, he finished the project on time.
description: É usada para introduzir uma ideia contrastante ou contraditória em relação à ideia principal da frase.

example: She was the most qualified candidate; therefore, she got the job. | The weather was bad, therefore the event was canceled. | He didn't study for the test; therefore, he didn't pass.
description: É usado para indicar uma consequência ou conclusão com base em algo previamente mencionado.

example: We walked through the park on our way home. | She looked through the window and saw the rain. | The project took a long time to finish, but we got through it (finalizá-lo).
Nowadays, many people prefer to work from home. | It's hard to find a good job nowadays. | Nowadays, we have access to information instantly through the internet.
description: É usado para se referir ao tempo presente, especialmente em comparação com o passado.

example: I suppose we could try that new restaurant tonight. | Do you suppose he will be there ? | I suppose she has already left the office.
description: É utilizado quando queremos expressar algo que acreditamos ser verdadeiro, mas sem ter certeza absoluta.

translation: Nos exemplos está sendo usado como [deveria]
example: You were supposed to finish the project by Friday. | The meeting is supposed to start at 10 AM. | She was supposed to call me, but she never did.
description: Pode ser usado para indicar algo que é esperado, sugerido ou considerado verdadeiro, embora possa não ser necessariamente o caso.

translation: Avaliação | Exame | Análise de algo especialmente para medir seu valor, qualidade ou desempenho.
example: The teacher gave us an assessment at the end of the semester. | The company's financial assessment shows positive growth. | I will need an assessment of your skills before deciding.

translation: Dirigir-se para algum lugar | Liderar algo
example: We headed (fomos) to the beach early in the morning. | She headed (liderou) the marketing team for five years. | After dinner, they headed (foram) home.

translation: Se arrastar. | Demorar mais que o esperado.
example: The meeting dragged on for hours. | The movie was interesting at first, but then it dragged on. | Their argument dragged on for weeks without a resolution.
At first, I found the new job difficult, but now I enjoy it. | She didn’t like the city at first, but she got used to it. |

You should sleep at least eight hours a night. | It was raining, but at least we had umbrellas. | He didn’t win the race, but at least he finished it. | At first, we planned to travel by car, but we decided to fly instead.
By the way, have you seen my keys ? | I love this restaurant. By the way, their pizza is amazing ! | By the way, I won’t be able to attend the meeting tomorrow.

translation: Desistir | Abrir mão | Parar de tentar
example: I won’t give up on my dreams. | He gave up smoking last year. | Don’t give up! Keep trying.
This test was really tough (difícil). | She is a tough (forte) woman who never gives up. | The steak was too tough (duro) to eat.
She always encourages her friends to follow their dreams. | Teachers should encourage students to ask questions. | My parents encouraged me to try new things.
Despite the difficulties, she remained calm. | I will remain here until you come back.
I heard a buzz in my ear when I was near the beehive (colmeia). | There was a lot of buzz about the new movie release. | There’s always a buzz at the office when a big project is about to start.
description: Pode ser usado como substantivo ou verbo e tem diferentes significados. Pode se referir a um som contínuo (como o de uma abelha), uma sensação de energia ou excitação, ou até a um burburinho sobre algo.

example: It's a joy to see tou again. | She was filled with joy when she received the good news. | The children's laughter brought joy to everyone in the room. |

translation: Parecer | Ter aparência de algo ou alguém
example: She looks like her mother. | The sky looks like it's going to rain. | That new restaurant looks like a great place to eat.
The company will release the new product next month. | The movie will be released in theaters this summer.

translation: Preencher | Encher | Acrescentar algo a um espaço vazio
example: Please fill out the form with your personal details. | She filled the glass with water. | The manager asked me to fill in (substituí-lo) for him during his absence.
description: Substituir alguém temporariamente [fill in]. Preencher formulários, documentos ... [fill out]

example: Her laughter was contagious, and everyone in the room started laughing. | We could hear the laughter of children playing outside. | He couldn't hold back (segurar) his laughter when he heard the joke.
description: É o som ou expressão de alegria ou diversão

example: She was afraid that the truth would be exposed during the trial. | The documentary exposes the impact of climate change on the environment. | The investigation will expose the company's unethical (antiética) practices. | Exposure (exposição) to the sun for too long can expose your skin to harmful (nocivos) effects.
Please go away, I'm busy right now. | She told him to go away after the argument (discussão). | The kids went away for the weekend to visit their grandparents.
description: [Go away] tende a ser mais direto e usado para pedir que alguém se afaste de maneira imediata, enquanto [Leave] é mais neutro e usado para indicar a ação de sair, sem a mesma ênfase em afastamento.

example: The company hired a new manager last week. | She was hired as a software developer. | We need to hire more staff for the project.
description: Geralmente usado em contexto de trabalho

example: He drives carefully to avoid accidents. | She avoided talking about the argument. | I always avoid him at work. | She crossed (atravessou) the street to avoid the crowd (multidão). | He avoided making eye contact with her.
description: Tomar medidas para impedir que algo aconteça ou para não entrar em contato com algo ou alguém.

example: The company will deploy (implantar) a new security system next week. | The army deployed (posicionar) thousands of soldiers to the border. | We need to deploy (implantar) the latest version of the app today.
The forest soundscape at night is filled with the sounds of crickets and owls. | The city's soundscape includes car horns, people talking, and distant music.

translation: Conquistas | Realizações | Feitos alcançados por meio de esforços
example: Winning the championship was one of his greatest achievements. | She takes pride (se orgulha) in her academic achievements. | The scientist’s achievements in medicine saved many lives. | The scientist’s achievements in medicine saved many lives.
The necklace is adorned with beautiful gems. | That book is a hidden gem; not many people know about it. | She is one of the gems of the company, always bringing innovative ideas.
She has read countless books.

translation: Passo | Etapa | Medida (ação tomada para alcançar algo)
example: She took a step forward and opened the door. | Learning a new language is a step-by-step process. | The company took an important step toward sustainability.
She stretches every morning to stay flexible. | The road stretches for miles ahead. | He tried to stretch the budget to make it last longer (duasse mais).
I am stuck in traffic.
I cherish our friendsship. | I will always cherish the memories of my childhood. | She cherishes the time spent with her family. | He cherished every moment of his life.
He leads the team with great dedication. | The teacher leads the students in various activities. | He led the team to victory last year. | She led the discussion during the meeting.
description: Passado é [led]

translation: Vagar | Perambular | Andar sem rumo | Divagar
example: He loves to wander through the city at night. | My mind tends to wander when I'm bored. | She spent hours wandering in the park.
description: O passado é [wandered]

example: She turned the key in the lock to open the door. | The weather can turn cold in the evening. | If you turn left at the traffic lights, you'll find the café. | The leaves turned yellow in the fall.

translation: Para dentro de algo | Transformar-se em algo | Indicar uma ação ou direção que leva a algo
example: She jumped into the pool. | He put his keys into (dentro) his bag. | Are you going into the store now ? | He didn’t get into the university he wanted.

The sight of the mountains filled me with awe. | The children looked at the fireworks (fogos de artifício) in awe (com espanto). | The audience was in awe of the performer’s talent. | The breathtaking view awed (impressionou) everyone.
description: A palavra [awe] é geralmente associada a coisas extraordinárias que provocam um sentimento de reverência e humildade diante de sua grandeza ou beleza. Ou como verbo [to awe] impressionar

example: She sat on the couch (sofá), munching on popcorn while watching a movie. | The rabbit was happily munching on a carrot. | He munched on an apple as he read his book.
His eye twitched from exhaustion. | She felt a twitch in her hand after holding the heavy bag for too long. | The cat twitched its tail before jumping.
description: De forma involuntária ou de maneira curta e abrupta.

example: I decided to switch my phone for a newer model. | Can you switch to another TV channel ?

translation: Correr rapidamente, avançar em alta velocidade.
example: He dashed to catch the last train. | She dashed into the room with exciting news.
She basked in the warm sunlight (sol quente) on the beach. | He basked in the glory of his achievement.
description: Desfrutar de algo bom ou Aquecer-se ao sol ou ao calor

example: The star was glowing. | The fireflies (vagalumes) glowed in the dark. | Her face glowed with happiness. | The city skyline (horizonte da cidade) glowed under the sunset (por do sol).
The cat is under the table. | She is under a lot of stress at work. | Children under 12 get a discount.
description: Posição física abaixo de algo (debaixo de, sob). | Estar submetido a uma condição ou influência. | Menos que um determinado número ou valor (abaixo de)

example: The lamp is hanging (pendurada) over the table. | He jumped over the fence. | There were over 50 people at the party. | The game is over.
description: Posição acima de algo | Movimento de um lado para outro | Quantidade maior que um determinado número ou valor | Encerramento ou término de algo

example: She whispered a secret in my ear. | They were whispering during the meeting. | The wind whispered through the trees.
He stumbled on a rock while walking in the park. | She stumbled into the room after drinking too much. | I stumbled over my words during the presentation.
That movie was so funny! I couldn't stop laughing. | There's something funny about this situation. | He told me a funny joke at the party.
She loves to cuddle with her cat on the couch. | The baby cuddled his teddy bear while sleeping. | hey cuddled under the blanket (cobertor) to stay warm (ficar aquecido)
Do you have any further question ? | We need to walk further (mais distante) to reach the village. | Do you need further information about the project ? |
She is an excellent student. Furthermore, she always helps her classmates. | The project is behind schedule. Furthermore, we are running out of budget. |
We finally reached the hotel after a long trip. | She reached her goal of becoming a doctor. | I don’t think it’s a good idea. Furthermore, it could be risky
We will leave in a little while. | She said she would call me back in a little while. | Dinner will be ready in a little while.
description: Usado para indicar que algo acontecerá em um curto período de tempo. (um período mais curto que [soon]

example: Can you explain this math problem to me ? | She explained the rules before the game started. | He had to explain why he was late for the meeting.
She greeted her guests with a warm smile. | He greeted me by shaking my hand. | The teacher greeted the students as (quando) they entered the classroom.
description: Usado para descrever o ato de saudar alguém de maneira amigável, seja com palavras, gestos ou expressões.

example: She loves to solve riddles in her free time. | Can you guess the answer to this riddle ? | The ancient book was full of riddles and secret messages.
She was worried about the test results. | Don’t be worried, everything will be fine. |
description: Sentir ansiedade, inquietação ou apreensão sobre algo que pode acontecer. | He looked worried when he heard the news.

example: I disagree with you on this topic. | They often disagree about politics. | We can disagree and still be friends.
description: Passado [disagreed]
Passado [agreed]

example: Don't leave (deixe) your phone on the table. | My flight leaves at 8 AM. | He left his jacket in the car.
description: Passado [left]

translation: Apressar-se | Agir rapidamente | Fazer algo com urgência
example: Hurry up! (apressa-se!) The movie is about to start. | She hurried to catch the last bus. | We need to hurry or we will miss our flight. | I was hurrying to finish my work before the deadline.

translation: O dia inteiro | Durante todo o dia.
example: I've been working all day long. | She was singing all day long. | It rained all day long yesterday. | The kids played outside all day long.
She is proud of her achievements. | I'm so proud of you! | They felt proud after finishing the project. | He walked into the room with a proud smile.

translation: Estar atrasado ou se atrasando para um compromisso
example: I'm running late for work! She was running late, so she took a taxi. | Sorry, I'm running late. I'll be there in 10 minutes. | We can't stop now. We're already running late!
Even when it's hard, you have to keep going. | She kept going despite all the challenges. | Don't stop now! Keep going until you finish. | If you keep going in this direction, you'll reach the park.

translation: De tempo em tempo | Ocasionamente | De vez em quando
example: I like to go hiking from time to time. | She calls her grandmother from time to time. | From time to time, we all need a break. | He visits his hometown from time to time.
I'll be more careful next time. | Next time, don’t forget to call me. | She promised to arrive on time next time. | Next time we meet, let’s go for coffee.

translation: Há pouco tempo | Não faz muito tempo
example: I saw her not long ago. | Not long ago, we moved to a new house. | He started his new job not long ago. | Not long ago, people didn't have smartphones.

translation: Você decide | Depende de você | A escolha é sua
example: Where do you want to go for dinner ? It's up to you! | You can stay or leave, it's up to you. | Whether we take the train or drive is up to you (depende de você). | It's up to you to make the final decision.

translation: Boa ideia | Bem pensado | Bom raciocínio | Boa Sacada
example: You brought an umbrella ? Good thinking ! It might rain later. | Good thinking! We should double-check (conferir) the numbers before submitting the report. | She suggested making a backup copy of the files. Good thinking! | Good thinking, taking a shortcut! We arrived much earlier.
Please double-check your answers before submitting the test. |

Please double-check your answers before submitting the test. | I always double-check my work to avoid mistakes. | She double-checked the schedule to make sure nothing was missed. | Don't forget to double-check the ingredients before baking the cake.
description: Passado [double-checked]

example: Who cares what they think? Just do what makes you happy! | It's raining, but who cares? We can still have fun! | She said I was late, but who cares? It was just a few minutes. | I forgot to bring my notebook, but who cares? I can take notes on my phone.
I'm sorry, I overreacted to the situation. | He always overreacts when things don’t go his way. | Try not to overreact to small mistakes.
description: Passado [overreacted]

example: Frankly, I don't like this idea. | She spoke frankly about her concerns (preocupações). | Frankly, I expected better from you.
description: Pode ser também [Honestly]

example: That's not fair! You got more than me. | The judge made a fair decision.
I went to bed late last night. | She works late on Fridays.
I'll call you later. | See you later! | She arrived later (mais tarde) than expected. |
Can I borrow your pen ? | She borrowed a book from the library. | He borrowed some money from his brother. | I borrowed a dress from my friend for the party.
The bank loaned me $10,000. | I took out a loan (empréstimo) to buy a car. | The student loan (empréstimo estudantil) will take years to pay off (quitar). | We got a car loan (financiamento de carro)
description: Usado mais para dinheiro e bens de alto valor

example: I just wanted to say hello, that's all (só isso). If you don't want to go, just tell me. That's all (isso é tudo) I need to know. | I ordered a coffee and a sandwich, that's all.
You can rely (confiar) on me if you need help. | She relies (depende) on her parents for financial support. | I don’t rely (dependo) on luck; I work hard to achieve my goals.

translation: Qualquer um (de dois) | Também (em frases negativas)
example: You can take either road; both lead to the city. | I don’t like coffee. I don’t like tea either (também). | Either you apologize, or we can’t be friends anymore. | There are two options, but either (qualquer uma) choice will work.
You need to act fast in an emergency. | She wants to act in movies. | His kind act helped many people.
